definition: Yingzhou, easternmost of three fabled islands in Eastern sea, home of immortals and source of elixir of immortality

sentences.english: "Yingzhou" is one of the three ancient fairy mountains on the sea.
sentences.chinese: 瀛洲還是古老的海上三仙山之一。

sentences.english: The paper is a preliminary study of Liu Yingzhou who was a main representative of Jiangjing gang, Liu began his business at the age of 20.
sentences.chinese: 本文對江津幫的主要代表人物劉瀛洲做了初步的研究。

sentences.english: Yingzhou Hotel is a pseudo-classic building constructed of reinforced concrete.
sentences.chinese: 瀛洲賓館是採用鋼筋混凝土建造的仿古建築。

definition: Penglai county level city in Yantai 煙台|烟台, Shandong/Penglai, one of three fabled islands in Eastern sea, abode of immortals/by extension, fairyland
East China Sea/East Sea (Chinese mythology and ancient geography)
underground palace of ghouls, e.g. Asgard of Scandinavian mythology
Temple in Heaven (e.g. of the Jade Emperor)
Fusang, mythical island of ancient literature, often interpreted as Japan
Lingshan county in Qinzhou 欽州|钦州[Qin1 zhou1], Guangxi
division of China during earliest dynasties/fig. ancient China/Kyūshū, southernmost of Japan's four major islands
Xu Fu (3rd century BC), Qin dynasty court necromancer
the Jade lake on Mount Kunlun, residence of Xi Wangmu 西王母
